text: Protaetia aurichalcea is a species of flower-chafer beetle in the family Scarabaeidae. It is found in Asia. The ground colour of the beetle is bronze with white markings on the elytra. Males have spines apical elytral angles. Like other flower-beetles, adults visit flowers but they are known to sometimes visit bee hives and feed on pollen collected. ==References== Category:Cetoniinae
title: Protaetia aurichalcea
